Ångerman River.label: Ångerman River
Ångerman River.description: The Ångerman River is one of Sweden's longest rivers with a total length of 460 kilometers. It also has the third largest amount of water running through it, after Göta älv and Lule River. Wikipedia

Åre River.label: Öre River
Åre River.description: Öre River is a river in Sweden. Wikipedia

Üür River.label: Üür River
Üür River.description: The Üür River is a river in northeastern Khövsgöl, mainly in Tsagaan-Üür sum. The river is a tributary of the Eg River. Wikipedia

Öre River.label: Öre River
Öre River.description: Öre River is a river in Sweden. Wikipedia

Ösper.label: Ösper
Ösper.description: Ösper is a river of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. Wikipedia

Ažytė.label: Ažytė
Ažytė.description: The Ažytė is a river of Kėdainiai district municipality, Kaunas County, central Lithuania. It flows for 20 kilometres and has a basin area of 98 km². Wikipedia

Aar (Lahn).label: Aar
Aar (Lahn).description: The Aar is a 60 km-long river in western Germany, left tributary of the Lahn. It rises in the Taunus mountains, near Taunusstein. It flows generally north through the towns Taunusstein, Bad Schwalbach, Aarbergen and Hahnstätten. Wikipedia

Ach (Blau).label: Ach
Ach (Blau).description: The Ach is a river in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. Wikipedia

Ablach (Danube).label: Ablach
Ablach (Danube).description: The Ablach is a right tributary of the Danube. It rises on the European Watershed, which is only a hint in this area, from the Mindersdorfer Aach in the municipality of Hohenfels in the Landkreis of Konstanz. Wikipedia

Agno River.label: Agno River
Agno River.description: Agno River is a river in the Philippine island of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan. It is the fifth largest river system in the country with drainage area of 5,952 km². Wikipedia

Aich (river).label: Aich
Aich (river).description: The Aich is a river in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. It is approximately 29.7 kilometres long. It is located on the left tributary of the Neckar in Böblingen and Esslingen. Wikipedia

Aisne (river).label: Aisne
Aisne (river).description: The Aisne is a river in northeastern France, left tributary of the river Oise. It gave its name to the French département Aisne. It was known in the Roman period as Axona. Wikipedia

Aksu River (China).label: Aksu River
Aksu River (China).description: The Aksu River is a transboundary river in the Xinjiang province in China and Ak-Suu District of Issyk Kul Province of Kyrgyzstan. In Kyrgyzstan it is known as the Saryjaz River. The total length of the river is 282 km, of them 197 km in Kyrgyzstan. Wikipedia

Alte Elbe.label: Alte Elbe
Alte Elbe.description: Alte Elbe is a river of Saxony-Anhalt, Germany. Wikipedia

Alma River (Ukraine).label: Alma River
Alma River (Ukraine).description: The Alma is a small river in Crimea that flows into the Black Sea. Its mouth is located half-way between Yevpatoria and Sevastopol. Alma is the Crimean Tatar word for an "apple". Wikipedia

Alte Oder.label: Alte Oder
Alte Oder.description: The name Alte Oder refers to an old branch of the Oder River in Brandenburg, Germany. Today it drains the Oderbruch basin, flowing northwards to the confluence with the Oder near Hohensaaten. Wikipedia

Ammer (Neckar).label: Ammer
Ammer (Neckar).description:
The Ammer is a small river in Baden-Württemberg, Germany, a tributary of the Neckar.
It has its source southwest of Herrenberg. Wikipedia

Anaktuvuk River.label: Anaktuvuk River
Anaktuvuk River.description: The Anaktuvuk River is a river in Alaska's North Slope. One hundred and thirty-five miles long, it flows west from glaciers in the Endicott Mountains changing direction just north of Anaktuvuk Pass to ... Wikipedia

Apfelstädt (Gera).label: Apfelstädt (Gera)
Apfelstädt (Gera).description: Apfelstädt (Gera) is a river of Thuringia, Germany. Wikipedia

Arda (Maritsa).label: Arda
Arda (Maritsa).description: The Arda is a 290 km long river in Bulgaria and Greece. It is a tributary of the Maritsa. Its source lies in the Bulgarian Rhodope Mountains near the village Arda, part of the municipality of Smolyan. Wikipedia

Arsenyevka River.label: Arsenyevka River
Arsenyevka River.description:
The Arsenyevka River is a left tributary of the Ussuri River in Anuchinsky and Yakovlevsky Districts of Primorsky Krai, Russia.
The length of river is approximately 294 kilometers and its basin area is 7,060 square kilometers. Wikipedia

Assiniboine River.label: Assiniboine River
Assiniboine River.description: The Assiniboine River is a 1,070-kilometre river that runs through the prairies of Western Canada in Saskatchewan and Manitoba. It is a tributary of the Red River. Wikipedia

Aube (river).label: Aube
Aube (river).description:
The Aube is a river in France, right tributary of the Seine. It is 248 km long. The river gives its name to the Aube département.
Its source is in the Haute-Marne département, on the plateau of Langres, near the town Auberive. Wikipedia

Auma (river).label: Auma
Auma (river).description: Auma is a river of Thuringia, Germany. Wikipedia
Source: Linda bei Neustadt an der Orla

Ausa River.label: Ausa River
Ausa River.description: The Ausa River is a minor river some 17 kilometres in length which traverses part of northern San Marino and Emilia–Romagna in Italy. The source of the river is Monte Titano in central San Marino. Wikipedia

Aurach (Regnitz, Mittelfranken).label: Aurach (Regnitz, Mittelfranken)
Aurach (Regnitz, Mittelfranken).description:
Aurach (Regnitz, Mittelfranken) is a river of Bavaria, Germany. It is a tributary of the river Regnitz.
The river Aurach starts in Frankenhöhe to the west of Klaus Aurach in the municipality of Markt Erlbach. Wikipedia

Aveyron (river).label: Aveyron
Aveyron (river).description:
The Aveyron is a 291 km long river in southern France, right tributary of the Tarn River. It rises in the southern Massif Central, near Sévérac-le-Château.
In 1855 evidence of prehistoric man was found near Bruniquel under a hill called Montastruc. Wikipedia

Awali (river).label: Awali
Awali (river).description: The Awali is a perennial river flowing in Southern Lebanon. In ancient times it was known as the River Asclepius. It is 48 kilometres long, originating from the Barouk mountain at a height of 1,492 metres and the Niha mountain. Wikipedia

Ayalon River.label: Ayalon River
Ayalon River.description: The Ayalon River is a perennial stream in Israel, originating in the Judean Hills and mouthing into the Yarkon River in the Tel Aviv area. The total length of Ayalon River is about 50 kilometres and it drains an area of 815 square kilometres. Wikipedia

Bârlad River.label: Bârlad River
Bârlad River.description: The Bârlad is a river in eastern Romania, a tributary of the Siret River. Its total length is 207 kilometres. Its source is in the low hills between the Siret and Prut rivers, southwest of Iaşi. Wikipedia

Bârsa River (Olt).label: Bârsa River
Bârsa River (Olt).description: The Bârsa River is a tributary of the Olt River in Romania. It starts at the junction of two headwaters Bârsa Groşetului and Bârsa Tămaşului. Wikipedia

Bóbr.label: Eurasian beaver
Bóbr.description: The Eurasian beaver or European beaver is a species of beaver which was once widespread in Eurasia. It was hunted to near-extinction for both its fur and castoreum, and by 1900 only 1,200 beavers survived ... Wikipedia

Back River.label: Back River
Back River.description: The Back River, is a river in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut in Canada. It rises at an unnamed lake in the North Slave Region of the Northwest Territories and flows more than 974 kilometres mostly ... Wikipedia

Baker River (Washington).label: Baker River
Baker River (Washington).description: The Baker River is an approximately 30-mile, southward-flowing tributary of the Skagit River in northwestern Washington in the United States. Wikipedia

Bečva.label: Bečva
Bečva.description: The Bečva is a river in the Czech Republic. It is a left tributary of the river Morava. The Bečva is created by two source streams, the Northern Rožnovská Bečva and the Southern Vsetínská Bečva. Wikipedia

Bear River (Washington).label: Bear River
Bear River (Washington).description: The Bear River is a river in the U.S. state of Washington. Its upper reach is known as Bear Branch. Wikipedia

Bei River.label: Bei River
Bei River.description:
Bei River is the northern tributary of the Pearl River in southern China. The other two main tributaries of the Pearl River are the Xijiang River and the Dongjiang River.
The Bei River is 63.34 kilometers long and located in northern Guangdong. Wikipedia

Ben Hai River.label: Bến Hải River
Ben Hai River.description: The Bến Hải River is a river in central Vietnam which became an important landmark in the partition of the country into a northern and a southern zone along the 17th parallel by the Geneva Accords of 1954. Wikipedia

Berner Au.label: Berner Au
Berner Au.description: Berner Au is a river of Hamburg, Germany. Wikipedia

Big Quilcene River.label: Big Quilcene River
Big Quilcene River.description: The Big Quilcene River is a river on the Olympic Peninsula in the U.S. state of Washington. It rises in the Buckhorn Wilderness near Marmot Pass, south of Buckhorn Mountain, and near Mount Constance. Wikipedia

Biya River.label: Biya River
Biya River.description: The Biya River is a river in the Altai Republic and Altai Krai in Russia. It forms the Ob River as it joins the Katun River. The Biya River is 301 km long; the area of its drainage basin is 37,000 km². It flows out of the Teletskoye Lake. Wikipedia

Black Elster.label: Black Elster
Black Elster.description: The Black Elster or Schwarze Elster is a 179 km long river in eastern Germany, in the states Saxony, Brandenburg and Saxony-Anhalt, right tributary of the Elbe. Its source is in the Upper Lusatia region, near Elstra. Wikipedia

Blanice (Sázava).label: Blanice
Blanice (Sázava).description: The Blanice is a river located primarily in the Central Bohemian Region of the Czech Republic. It is a 66 kilometres left tributary of the Sázava. Wikipedia

Bolshoy Kundysh River.label: Bolshoy Kundysh River
Bolshoy Kundysh River.description: Bolshoy Kundysh is a river in Kirov Oblast and Mari El, Russia, a right tributary of the Bolshaya Kokshaga River. It is 173 km long, its drainage basin is 1720 km². Bolshoy Kundysh flows across the fen of the Mari depression. Wikipedia

Bojana (river).label: Bojana
Bojana (river).description: The Bojana or Buna, is a 41 km long river in Albania and Montenegro which flows into the Adriatic Sea. Wikipedia

Bröl.label: Bröl
Bröl.description:
The Bröl is a 45.1 km long right tributary of the Sieg River in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
The river flows through the districts of Rhein-Sieg-Kreis and Oberbergischer Kreis. Wikipedia

Brandenberger Ache.label: Brandenberger Ache
Brandenberger Ache.description: The Brandenberger Ache River is a 22 km long left tributary of the Inn River in the district Kufstein and flows from North to South to the town of Rattenberg where it merges with the Inn River. Wikipedia

Bregenzer Ache.label: Bregenzer Ache
Bregenzer Ache.description: The Bregenzer Ache is the main river of the Bregenz Forest, in the Austrian state of Vorarlberg. It is a tributary to Lake Constance. Wikipedia

Brenz (river).label: Brenz
Brenz (river).description: The Brenz is a river in Baden-Württemberg and Bavaria, Germany. It is a left tributary of the Danube. Wikipedia

Brisbane River.label: Brisbane River
Brisbane River.description: The Brisbane River is the longest river in south east Queensland, Australia, and flows through the city of Brisbane, before emptying into Moreton Bay. Wikipedia

Cèze.label: Cèze
Cèze.description: The Cèze is a French river, a tributary of the Rhone. It runs through the departments of Lozère and Gard in the Languedoc-Roussillon region. Its source is in the Cévennes mountains, near Saint-André-Capcèze. Wikipedia

Casiquiare canal.label: Casiquiare canal
Casiquiare canal.description: The Casiquiare river is a distributary of the upper Orinoco flowing southward into the Rio Negro, in Venezuela, South America. As such, it forms a unique natural canal between the Orinoco and Amazon river systems. Wikipedia

Cebollatí River.label: Cebollatí River
Cebollatí River.description: Cebollati river is a Uruguayan river that rises in Cuchilla Grande, flows southwest to northeast and forms a border between Treinta y Tres and Rocha. At roughly 235 kilometres, it is one of the longest rivers in Uruguay. Wikipedia

Chagodoshcha River.label: Chagodoshcha River
Chagodoshcha River.description: The Chagodoshcha is a river in Boksitogorsky District of Leningrad Oblast and in Chagodoshchensky, Babayevsky, and Ustyuzhensky Districts of Vologda Oblast in Russia. It is a left tributary of the Mologa River. Wikipedia

Chapayevka River.label: Chapayevka River
Chapayevka River.description: Chapayevka or the Mocha is a river in Samara Oblast, Russia, a left tributary of the Volga River. It origins at the slope of Siny Syrt and flows to the Saratov Reservoir, near Novokuybyshevsk, Samara agglomeration. It is 298 km long. Wikipedia

Chassezac.label: Chassezac
Chassezac.description: The Chassezac is an 84.6 km long river in the Lozère, Gard and Ardèche départements, southern France, right tributary of the Ardèche. Wikipedia

Chattahoochee River.label: Chattahoochee River
Chattahoochee River.description: The Chattahoochee River forms the southern half of the Alabama and Georgia border, as well as a portion of the Florida border. Wikipedia

Chira River.label: Chira River
Chira River.description:
Chira is the name of a river in northern Peru whose mouth is 20 km north of the provincial capital of Piura.
Its source is in the Ecuadorian Andes near the town of Papaca in the province Loja from where it flows for ca 250 km in easterly directions. Wikipedia

Chrudimka.label: Chrudimka River
Chrudimka.description: Chrudimka is a river in the Pardubice Region in the Czech Republic. It is a left tributary of Labe, beginning near Hlinsko and flowing mostly northward to the city of Pardubice. Wikipedia

Churchill River (Atlantic).label: Churchill River
Churchill River (Atlantic).description: The Churchill River is a river in Newfoundland and Labrador which flows east from the Smallwood Reservoir in Labrador into the Atlantic Ocean via Lake Melville. Wikipedia

Cibin River.label: Cibin River
Cibin River.description: Cibin is a river in central Romania, in the South part of Transylvania. Its source is in the Cindrel Mountains of the Southern Carpathian Mountains. The river is formed at the junction of two headwaters Râul Mare and Râul Mic. Wikipedia

Coco River.label: Coco River
Coco River.description: The Río Coco, formerly known as the Río Segovia, Cape River, or Yara River, is a river in southern southern Honduras and northern Nicaragua. The Miskito Indians who live along the river know it as the Wanki or Wanks River. Wikipedia

Coosa River.label: Coosa River
Coosa River.description:
The Coosa River is a tributary of the Alabama River in the U.S. states of Alabama and Georgia. The river is about 280 miles long altogether.
The Coosa River is one of Alabama's most developed rivers. Wikipedia

Copiapó River.label: Copiapó River
Copiapó River.description: Copiapó River is a river of Chile located in the Atacama Region. Starting at the confluence of the Jorquera and Pulido rivers, the Copiapó flows for only 2.5 km before receiving the waters of the Manflas River. Wikipedia

Cowlitz River.label: Cowlitz River
Cowlitz River.description: The Cowlitz River is a river in the state of Washington in the United States, a tributary of the Columbia River. Its tributaries drain a large region including the slopes of Mount Rainier, Mount Adams, and Mount St. Helens. Wikipedia

Cumberland River.label: Cumberland River
Cumberland River.description: The Cumberland River is a major waterway of the Southern United States. The 688-mile-long river drains almost 18,000 square miles of southern Kentucky and north-central Tennessee. Wikipedia

Dahme (river).label: Dahme
Dahme (river).description: The Dahme is a river that flows through the Brandenburg and Berlin states of Germany. It is a left bank tributary of the River Spree and is approximately 95 kilometres in length. Wikipedia

Deûle.label: Deûle
Deûle.description: The Deûle is a river of northern France which is channeled for the main part of its course. The upstream part is still partly free-flowing and is known as the Souchez. The Deûle flows into the Lys in Deûlémont. Wikipedia

Dhünn (Wupper).label: Dhünn (Wupper)
Dhünn (Wupper).description: Dhünn is a 40 km-long river of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. Its main source is near Wipperfürth in the Bergisches Land area. It runs in south-westerly direction, and its mouth into the river Wupper is near Leverkusen, appr. Wikipedia

Detroit River.label: Detroit River
Detroit River.description: The Detroit River is a 24-nautical-mile-long river in the Great Lakes system. The name comes from the French Rivière du Détroit, which translates literally as River of the Strait. Wikipedia

Desaguadero River (Bolivia).label: Desaguadero River
Desaguadero River (Bolivia).description: The Desaguadero River in Peru and Bolivia is the river that drains Lake Titicaca. It exits the lake at the southern part of the river basin, it flows south and drains approximately five percent of the ... Wikipedia

Diamantina River.label: Diamantina River
Diamantina River.description:
The Diamantina River is a river in Central West Queensland and the far north of South Australia.
The river was named by William Landsborough in 1866 for Lady Diamantina Bowen, wife of Sir George Ferguson Bowen, the first Governor of Queensland. Wikipedia

Dove Elbe.label: Dove Elbe
Dove Elbe.description:
The Dove Elbe is a closed anabranch of the Unterelbe, the lower part of the river Elbe.
The inflow is blocked by a dike since 1438. The lower end was shortened by a redirection of the Norderelbe in 1579. Wikipedia

Drac (river).label: Drac
Drac (river).description: The Drac is a 130 km long river in southeastern France, left tributary of the Isère. It is formed by the confluence of the Drac Noir and the Drac Blanc, that both rise in the southern part of the Massif des Écrins. Wikipedia

Dieße.label: Dieße
Dieße.description: Dieße is a river of Lower Saxony, Germany. Wikipedia

Drut River.label: Drut River
Drut River.description:
Drut is a river in Belarus, a right tributary of Dnieper. It originates in the Orsha Upland in the Belarusian Ridge and flows through Vitebsk, Mogilev and Homiel provinces of Belarus.
Cities of Tolochin and Rogachev are located by Drut. Wikipedia

Emajõgi.label: Emajõgi
Emajõgi.description: The Emajõgi is a river in Estonia which flows from Lake Võrtsjärv through Tartu County into Lake Peipus, crossing the city of Tartu for 10 km. It has a length of 100 km. The name Emajõgi means "Mother River" in Estonian. Wikipedia

Ems (Eder).label: Ems
Ems (Eder).description: Ems is a river of Hesse, Germany. Wikipedia

Emmerbach.label: Emmerbach
Emmerbach.description: Emmerbach is a river of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. Wikipedia

Erlenbach (Nidda).label: Erlenbach
Erlenbach (Nidda).description: Erlenbach is a river of Hesse, Germany. Wikipedia

Falschauer.label: Falschauer
Falschauer.description: The Falschauer is a river in South Tyrol, Italy. Wikipedia

Ettenbach.label: Ettenbach
Ettenbach.description: Ettenbach is a river of Baden-Württemberg, Germany. Wikipedia

Eure (river).label: Eure
Eure (river).description: The Eure is a river in northern France, left tributary of the Seine. It rises at Marchainville in the Orne département and joins the Seine near Pont-de-l'Arche. Two départements are named after the Eure, namely Eure and Eure-et-Loir. Wikipedia

Flumendosa.label: Flumendosa
Flumendosa.description: The Flumendosa is a river of southern Sardinia, Italy. With a length of 127 km, it is the second river of the island behind the Tirso. Wikipedia

Fly River.label: Fly River
Fly River.description: The Fly at 1,050 kilometres, is the second longest river in Papua New Guinea, after the Sepik. The Fly is the largest river in Oceania, the largest in the world without a single dam in its catchment, ... Wikipedia
